Smoking_History: The patient smokes half a pack per day for the past 40 years.
Alcohol_Consumption: The patient drinks alcohol on an occasional basis.
Pack_Years: 20
Patient_Concerns: Anxiety at night affecting sleep and other activities.
Recommendations: Concurrent chemoradiation therapy to the bilateral neck.
Follow_up_Actions: Medical Oncology consultation, ENT consultation, Psychology consultation, Nutrition consultation, GI consult for a PEG tube, planning CT scan for radiation preparation.
HPV_Status: Not inferred
Patient_History_Status_Former_Status_of_Patient: Remote cholecystectomy at the age of 17, nasal bridge repair, right forearm fracture followed by internal fixation, arthritis and disk.
Patient_History_Status_Similar_Conditions: Family history of breast cancer (mother) and cervical cancer (sister).
Patient_History_Status_Previous_Treatments: Antibiotics for the neck lump.
Clinical_Assessments_Radiological_Lesions: 4 x 4.5 x 3.2-cm large lymph node at the right jugulodigastric area, smaller nodes in the same area, 9-mm node in the right supraclavicular area, subcentimetric lymph nodes at level 3 and 4.
Clinical_Assessments_SUV_from_PET_scans: High SUV uptake of 10.5 for the main lymph node, SUV of 6.3 for a smaller node, SUV ranging from 2.7 to 3.7 for other subcentimetric lymph nodes.
